Other Bitcoin ATM Options in Hong Kong (2025)

Beyond Localcoin and CoinUnit, Hong Kong has a growing but still concentrated Bitcoin ATM scene, with around 200-250 machines total across operators (per CoinATM Radar data as of October 2025). These alternatives focus on cash-to-crypto buys (HKD notes), with similar high fees (7-10%) driven by operations and compliance. All comply with SFC rules, offer quick QR wallet scans, and require minimal KYC for small amounts. Here’s a comparison of the key other providers:

Operator Supported Coins Fees (Buy with HKD) Number of ATMs Locations Summary
CoinHero BTC, ETH, BCH, DOGE 8.6% + HKD 100 fixed (BTC/ETH/DOGE); 1% BCH; min. HKD 100 50+ in HK (part of 80+ Asia-wide) Widespread: Causeway Bay (flagship), Aberdeen, Kowloon areas; 24/7 in many spots
HK Bitcoin ATM BTC (primarily; some ETH/LTC) ~8-10% (dynamic, shown on-screen); flat fees ~HKD 50-100 10-15 Central, Mong Kok, Causeway Bay, Tuen Mun; mostly daytime (11am-midnight)
Nitroswap BTC, ETH, BCH, LTC 7-9% + flat HKD 50-80; buy/sell 5-10 New Territories focus: Yuen Long, Tuen Mun; limited hours

These are smaller networks compared to the big two, so coverage is patchier—best for specific areas like Kowloon or New Territories. CoinHero stands out for Asia-wide scale and OTC options (3% fees for larger trades). For tourists or quick buys, HK Bitcoin ATM’s Central/Mong Kok spots are convenient. Always check real-time rates on-site, as blockchain fees are negligible (~HKD 5-10 for ETH/BTC).

If you need P2P alternatives (no ATM), options like Paxful or LocalCoinSwap let you buy via bank transfer/cash meetups with lower fees (1-5%), but less anonymity.
